column4: BP sees oil stock overhang weighing on prices beyond 2015
column5: LAUSANNE  Switzerland Global oil supply and demand will balance out by the end of the year but an oil stocks overhang of several hundreds of million of barrels will weigh on prices beyond 2015  BP's chief economist said on Tuesday.

column4: Cardinal Health settlement splits FTC along party lines
column5: The Federal Trade Commission split along political party lines in a deal announced on Monday in which Cardinal Health will pay $26.8 million to settle charges that it illegally monopolized markets in 25 cities for the sale of low-energy radiopharmaceuticals to hospitals and clinics.

column4: Chevron's Kazakh joint venture slows expansion plans due to weak oil price
column5: ATYRAU  Kazakhstan  April 21 Kazakhstan's leading oil producer has slowed its expansion plans further and cut planned spending this year in response to lower oil prices  a senior executive at Chevron's joint venture Tengizchevroil (TCO) said.

column4: VMware reports slowest revenue growth in seven quarters
column5: Virtualization software maker VMware Inc reported its slowest revenue growth in seven quarters as IT spending remained sluggish and a stronger dollar reduced the value of overseas sales.

column4: UPDATE 1-VMware reports slowest revenue growth in 7 quarters
column5: April 21 Virtualization software maker VMware Inc reported its slowest revenue growth in seven quarters as IT spending remained sluggish and a stronger dollar reduced the value of overseas sales.

column4: VMware 1st-qtr revenue rises 11 pct
column5: April 21 Virtualization software maker VMware Inc reported an 11 percent rise in quarterly revenue due to strong demand for its products that help cut the cost of moving data to the cloud.

column4: India's Wipro promotes Premji heir apparent to board
column5: BENGALURU Wipro Ltd   India's third-biggest software services exporter  has appointed the son of billionaire founder Azim Premji to its board  in a long awaited promotion that moves the chairman's heir apparent closer to the top spot.

column4: UPDATE 2-India's Wipro promotes Premji heir apparent to board
column5: * Gives tepid forecast for IT services sales in June qtr   (Adds analyst  CEO comments  details)

column4: India's Wipro Q4 profit ticks up 2 pct; beats forecasts
column5: BENGALURU  April 21 Wipro Ltd  India's third-biggest software services exporter  reported a 2 percent rise in quarterly profit on Tuesday  beating estimates thanks to a rise in its Western clients' technology spending.

column4: Yum CEO says China business mending  sees strong year-end finish
column5: Yum Brands Inc  owner of KFC and Pizza Hut chains  on Tuesday said business in its biggest market China is recovering from a meat scare at one of its minor suppliers and the division would finish the year strong.

column4: UPDATE 2-Yum CEO says China business mending  sees strong year-end finish
column5: April 21 Yum Brands Inc  owner of KFC and Pizza Hut chains  on Tuesday said business in its biggest market China is recovering from a meat scare at one of its minor suppliers and the division would finish the year strong.

column4: Yum's China restaurant sales drop less than expected
column5: April 21 Yum Brands Inc  owner of KFC and Pizza Hut  said on Tuesday that sales at established restaurants in its biggest market China fell less than expected for the first quarter as it works to recover from a food scandal involving a minor supplier.

column4: UPDATE 1-West Face to wage proxy battle against Gran Tierra Energy
column5: TORONTO  April 21 Canadian activist firm West Face Capital Inc on Tuesday launched a proxy battle against Gran Tierra Energy and outlined plans to put up a slate of six nominees for the energy firm's board  saying that its current four-member board has failed investors.

column4: West Face to wage proxy battle against Gran Tierra Energy
column5: TORONTO  April 21 Canadian activist firm West Face Capital Inc outlined plans to put up a slate of six board nominees and wage a proxy battle against energy company Gran Tierra Energy Inc on Tuesday  saying that its current four-member board has failed investors.
